comments:
2.1 RC1 build. on AIX.
Launching standalone help and displaying help in one step results in help 
system starting, but browser not openning up.  The exception about timout is 
written to the console.  Running command again from another window, opens Help.
I have not used the -servertimout option, but may be the default should be 
longer.

% /usr/java131/bin/java -cp plugins/org.eclipse.help_2.1.0/help.jar 
org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp -data standalone 
java.lang.Exception: Timeout waiting for file standalone/.metadata/.connection
Eclipse is not running.
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.EclipseConnection.renew
(EclipseConnection.java:113)
        at 
org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.EclipseController.sendHelpCommand
(EclipseController.java:87)
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.displayHelp
(StandaloneHelp.java:99)
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.executeCommand
(StandaloneHelp.java:130)
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.main
(StandaloneHelp.java:61)
        at org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help.main(Help.java:151)

This only happened on the first launch, when platform metadata did not exist.  
After closing and launching again, help opened.

Eclipse and its workspace were not on the local har disk, but on the network.  
That could have impact on speed and locking of files.

specifying -servertimout option should be used in such situations.  We cannot 
indefinetely keep increasing the default timeout as it has negative effect on 
how fast you can restart infocenter (issue start after shutdown) on faster 
machines.
